{{Use mdy dates|date=November 2011}} {{Infobox College baseball team |name = Southern Illinois Salukis |founded = 1947 |logo = |logo_size = |university = Southern Illinois University |conference = Missouri Valley Conference |conference_short = MVC |city = Carbondale |stateabb = IL |state = Illinois |coach = Dan Callahan |tenure = 16th |stadium = [[Abe Martin Field]] |capacity = 4,000 |nickname = [[Southern Illinois Salukis|Salukis]] |color1 = Maroon |color2 = White |color3 = |fontcolor = ffffff |hex1 = 800000 |hex2 = ffffff |hex3 = |cws = 1968, 1969, 1971, 1974, 1977 |ncaa_tourneys = 1966, 1967, 1968, 1969, 1970, 1971, 1973, 1974, 1976, 1977, 1978, 1981, 1986, 1990 |conference_tournament = 1977, 1978, 1981, 1990 |conference_champion = 1975, 1976, 1977, 1978, 1981, 1984, 1986, 1990 }} The '''Southern Illinois Salukis baseball team''' represents [[Southern Illinois University Carbondale|Southern Illinois University]] in [[National Collegiate Athletic Association|NCAA]] [[Division I (NCAA)|Division I]] [[college baseball]]. They are part of the [[Missouri Valley Conference]]. ==History== SIU baseball started as a club sport in 1921, lasting until 1924. From 1925 until 1946, the school did not have a baseball program. In 1947, [[Glenn Martin (coach)|Abe Martin]] revived the program as an intercollegiate sport and it has remained ever since, being an elite program in the late 1960s through the 1980s. SIU plays its home games at [[Abe Martin Field]] but also occasionally plays home games at [[Rent One Park]] in nearby [[Marion, IL|Marion]], home of the [[Frontier League|Frontier League's]] [[Southern Illinois Miners]]. ==SIU in the NCAA tournament== SIU has a proud history in the NCAA Baseball Tournament, held at [[Johnny Rosenblatt Stadium]] in [[Omaha, NE|Omaha]] since 1950. They have made the [[College World Series]] 5 times and finished as the national champion runner-up twice, losing out to the [[USC Trojans baseball|University of Southern California]] [[USC Trojans|Trojans]] both times, as well as two third place finishes. {| border="0" width="100%" | valign="top" | {| cellpadding="1" border="1" cellspacing="0" width="70%" class="wikitable sortable" ! style="background: #800000; color:#FFFFFF; width:10%"|Year ! style="background: #800000; color:#FFFFFF; width:10%"|Record ! style="background: #800000; color:#FFFFFF; width:10%"|Pct ! style="background: #800000; color:#FFFFFF; width:40%"|Notes |- align="center" | [[1966 NCAA Division I Baseball Tournament|1966]] | 0â2 | .000 | Eliminated by [[Valparaiso Crusaders|Valparaiso]] |- align="center" | [[1967 NCAA Division I Baseball Tournament|1967]] | 1â2 | .333 | Eliminated by [[Western Michigan Broncos|Western Michigan]] |- align="center" | [[1968 NCAA Division I Baseball Tournament|1968]] | 6â2 | .750 | Eliminated by [[USC Trojans baseball|USC]] in championship game
[[1968 College World Series|College World Series (2nd place)]] |- align="center" | [[1969 NCAA Division I Baseball Tournament|1969]] | 3â2 | .600 | Eliminated by [[Ole Miss Rebels baseball|Ole Miss]]
